reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Two months with this pan, and I love it!
reviews.reviewText: After discarding all our old cookware after buying an induction-top range, I wanted a nice, induction-friendly stainless frypan to compliment our T-Fal non-stick sauté pan. This pan was a nicely priced option with some great reviews, so I thought I'd give it a try.If you're asking yourself, "Why two pans?" I'll give you three reasons why. The first is non-stick pans wear out and wear out really quickly if you cook over high heat, like when you sear meat. This pan doesn't deteriorate when you heat it on high and will last a lifetime. Non-stick pans also don't work well for recipes where a sauté is deglazed into a sauce. Finally, as non-stick surfaces wear out, they deposit chemicals in the food you cook on them, and that bugs me.So I have this non-stick frypan, and I am very happy with it. It has a nice heft to it, heats evenly, does a great job of everything from searing to sautéing, and is genuinely easy to clean. We do a lot of home cooking here and, two months in, it still looks like new.I thought I'd show you how easily this pan cleans up. The first picture I took was after a dinner where I sautéd all the vegetables for a veggie-heavy, one-pan zucchini-tomato-chickpea curry, then scooped up the leftovers and used a spatula to get the last of the sauce into two leftover storage containers. If you take a look at the picture, the pan was pretty clean even before it hit the sink. The second picture was taken a couple of minutes later after a drip of Dawn dish soap, some water, and few really quick swishes with a scrub brush cleaned it out, and this is what it looked like. No elbow grease was required. It shines!Here's one more cool thing about this pan: The lid for our 10-inch T-Fal E93897 non-stick pan is a great fit for this one, too. Having a well-fitting led comes in really handy so, if you're looking for that perfect pair of 10-inch standard and non-stick pans, this and the T-Fal might just be your perfect set.Pros:* Induction friendly.* Cooks evenly at every temperature.* No problems with warping.* Really great pan for not a lot of money.* Has been super easy to keep clean.* Mates well with the lid for T-Fal's 10-inch non-stick sauté pan, E93897.Cons:* I couldn't think of any!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect! Light weight, but heavy duty!
reviews.reviewText: These are absolutely perfect! I have used these six times already and have no complaints. I made eggs thus morning and they just slide right out off the pan! Nothing stuck!! Cleanup is super easy too!!! I highly recommend these for everyone and I'm so happy I purchased these. I recommend letting your oil/butter warm up in the pan before adding your food just keeps food from sticking and if it was to stick when you are finished cooking let pan cool down and wipe out what you can and then add water, bring to a boil and scrap off any food stuck on pan 😘

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price
reviews.reviewText: They are a good starter stainless steel pan for me. I really wanted to move away from non stick pans because of the chemicals and I was sick of throwing them out. I wish these were a bit sturdier. They can’t handle too much heat which can be tricky but that forces me to pay more attention while cooking; to be more intentional and in the moment, which isn’t a bad thing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality pans at a reasonable price.
reviews.reviewText: Have a mirror finish with high quality stainless steel on the inside you can tell it is good because the top is non-magnetic . The bottom plate will stick to a magnet and it boiled water on my induction burner. I have only cooked in it once and that was on the gas stove it distributed heat well. I expect it to get better after it is seasoned.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars They are nice!
reviews.reviewText: I got these for my daughter for Christmas and she loves them. Easy to clean too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Horrible heat management
reviews.reviewText: Stainless steel pans are great when you can keep the pan hot enough so things don’t stick. The welded plate on bottom rings this pans ability to manage heat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great pans for the price
reviews.reviewText: Love these pans! They clean up great and cook food better and faster. I love that the handle doesn’t get hot,too. The secret to cooking with stainless steel is that you have to let the pan get hot before you put in your food and then it won’t stick. Would definitely recommend these!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021
reviews.reviewText: If you are in college or just starting out then this pan will fit most needs. However if you like to really cook look for a better pan. The best pans are tri-ply pans but they cost more. I bought this pan just for one thing cooking sausages. Cleanup was very difficult. So now I just add water, cover and simmer for about 14 minutes. Drain water and roll them around in pan. If you really want to save money, spend the money and get All-Clad pans or similar professional pans as they will last a lifetime as they have lifetime warranty's.These are NOT professional grade pans as one reviewer claims. I am a Chef and professional pans are always tri-ply pans for even heat distribution. In allot restaurants that I have worked in and also at culinary school just use cheap aluminum pans make by Vollrath. I used a Vollrath pan to make a French Classic Omelette. They do not always want to spend money on good Tri=ply pans. However all chefs that I know used Tri-ply made of 18/10 grade stainless steel or Copper pans at home. Usually All-Clad or Calphalon. It all depends on what you are cooking. For non-stick pans I would say just go with a Vollrath non-stick pan. For cooking French Toast I just use a 12 inch T-Fal pan. I just bought a $135 Hex Clad pan combination Tri-ply and non-stick pan. I will write a review on that after I use it for awhile. And for good sakes when using non-stick pans DO NOT use mental utensils!
I'm pleasantly surprised by the quality at this price. It's almost non stick if you use it right. It's definitely better than my older stainless steel pan.
Son de muy buena calidad. Distribuyen muy bien el calor

reviews.reviewTitle: Eccellenti padelle tutte in acciaio con finiture di qualità nel manico.
reviews.reviewText: VOTO COMPLESSIVO: 95/100LE PADELLE:In numero di 2 elementi di diametro 20cm e 25cm, queste padelle sono composte per la totalità in acciaio inossidabile 18/8 e con fondale in alluminio e non ci sono tracce di BPA, nocivi all'uomo. Sono piuttosto leggere per quella che è la loro grandezza è ciò è dovuto all'acciaio ed all'alluminio che hanno ottime proprietà termiche mantenendo il peso basso. Un pregio è il manico, in acciaio, che è leggero resistente anche a padella riempita e mai si scalda per merito dell'aggancio alla padella effettuato tramite 2 rivetti sempre in acciaio che conferiscono un alta resistenza diminuendo la superficie di contatto con la padella e quindi la trasmissione del calore al manico. L'alluminio sul fondo della padella è ideale per una trasmissione del calore omogenea e rapida.LA MIA ESPERIENZA D'USO:La cosa eccezionale di queste padelle è il manico che non si scalda mai e ciò è possibile per mezzo di un'idea semplice ma efficace. Hanno una superficie piuttosto grande adatta ad un uso domestico piuttosto che professionale ma la qualità è all'altezza di prodotti professionali. La resa termica è eccezionale scaldandosi velocemente ed in maniera omogenea. L'acciaio in questione ha effetto antiaderente senza l'uso di pellicole dedicate che poi con l'uso si sfalderebbero nel cibo stesso. Padelle semplicemente eccellenti, migliori di tante e senza difetti evidenti.
